instruction: How did the researchers use machine learning models to distinguish between young and old leaves of Toona sinensis using UAV hyperspectral imaging technology?
Output: The researchers used UAV hyperspectral imaging technology to obtain canopy hyperspectral data of biennial seedlings of different varieties of Toona sinensis. They then trained five different machine learning models, namely Random Forest (RF), Artificial Neural Network (ANN), Decision Tree (DT), Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (PLSDA), and Support Vector Machine (SVM), to classify and distinguish between young and old leaves. They used raw spectra and six preprocessing methods to fit the best classification model. The SVM model showed the best performance, yielding higher accuracy, sensitivity, precision, and specificity compared to the other models. The SVM model based on the raw spectra produced the most reliable and robust prediction results, with 99.62% accuracy and 99.23% sensitivity on the validation set.

instruction: Can the SVM model based on raw spectra be used as a superior method compared to traditional methods for distinguishing between young and old leaves of Toona sinensis using UAV hyperspectral imaging technology?
